list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Version 5.0.2 Note: Requires Java 21. If you want to use older versions of Java, please use 4.x versions.
Replace daemon threads with virtual threads for improved performance
Dropped the class DaemonThread. You can use virtual thread instead of such a class.
Replaced all custom daemon thread implementations with virtual threads to leverage modern concurrency features. The transition improves system resource management and aligns with Java 21's capabilities. Also included minor bug fixes and optimizations for thread-safe behaviors.

task.summary: Default task

Version updated to 4.5.0
Compiled with Java 17. JSON class can understand more parameter types when an Object type is passed to the constructor or to the JSON.set method. Existing code may require a re-compilation.

Version updated to 4.5.1
Compiled with Java 17. JSON class can understand more parameter types when an Object type is passed to the constructor or to the JSON.set method. All extra type-specific constructors and set methods are dropped. Existing code may require a re-compilation.

Version updated to 4.5.2
Compiled with Java 17. JSON class can understand more parameter types when an Object type is passed to the constructor or to the JSON.set method. All extra type-specific constructors and set methods are dropped. Existing code may require a re-compilation.

Version updated to 4.5.3
Compiled with Java 17. JSON class can understand more parameter types when an Object type is passed to the constructor or to the JSON.set method. All extra type-specific constructors and set methods are dropped. Existing code may require a re-compilation.

Version updated to 4.5.3
Compiled with Java 17.

Version updated to 4.5.4
Compiled with Java 17. Removed left-trimming of US postal codes starting with zeros.

Version updated to 4.5.4
Compiled with Java 17. Removed left-trimming of US postal codes starting with zeros.

Version updated to 4.5.6
Compiled with Java 17. XXAddress is more usable now.

Version updated to 4.5.7
Compiled with Java 17. Minor code refactoring.

Version updated to 4.5.7
Compiled with Java 17. While JSONing BigDecimals, scientific notation was used. This is changed to plain value.

Version updated to 4.5.8
Compiled with Java 17. While JSONing BigDecimals, scientific notation was used. This is changed to plain value. Documentation update.

Version updated to 4.5.8
Compiled with Java 17. While JSONing BigDecimals, scientific notation was used. This is changed to plain value. Documentation update.

Version updated to 4.5.9
Compiled with Java 17. Added new class: StyledBuilder.Style Added additional methods in StyledBuilder that accept StyledBuilder.Style instances as parameters. Documentation update.

Version updated to 4.5.10
Compiled with Java 17. New method: StyledBuilder.Style.array

Version updated to 4.5.10
Compiled with Java 17. New method: StyledBuilder.Style.array

Version updated to 4.5.11
Compiled with Java 17. New method: StyledBuilder.setValue(Object object)

Version updated to 4.5.12
Compiled with Java 17. New methods in DateUtility

Version updated to 4.5.12
Compiled with Java 17. New methods in DateUtility

Version updated to 4.5.12
Compiled with Java 17. New methods in DateUtility

Version updated to 4.6.0
Compiled with Java 17. New class: DaemonThread

Update version to 4.7.0, add Fault class, and improve documentation
This commit adds a new 'Fault' class to handle system faults and errors. Additionally, minor changes are made to enhance the documentation of the DateUtility.java file, including correcting typos and improving phrasing for clarity.

Update version to 4.7.1, add Fault class, and improve documentation
This commit adds a new 'Fault' class to handle system faults and errors. Additionally, minor changes are made to enhance the documentation of the DateUtility.java file, including correcting typos and improving phrasing for clarity.

Update version to 4.7.1, add Fault class, and improve documentation
This commit adds a new 'Fault' class to handle system faults and errors. Additionally, minor changes are made to enhance the documentation of the DateUtility.java file, including correcting typos and improving phrasing for clarity.

Update version to 4.7.2, add Fault class, and improve documentation
This commit adds a new 'Fault' class to handle system faults and errors. Additionally, minor changes are made to enhance the documentation of the DateUtility.java file, including correcting typos and improving phrasing for clarity.

Update version to 4.7.3 and enhance USAddress class
The version number in the pom.xml file has been incremented to 4.7.3. In addition, new methods (getStateName, getStateCode, getZIPCode) have been added to the USAddress class to return state name, state code, and ZIP Code respectively. This enriches the functionality offered by the USAddress class for address handling.

Update version to 4.7.3 and enhance USAddress class
The version number in the pom.xml file has been incremented to 4.7.3. In addition, new methods (getStateName, getStateCode, getZIPCode, getCity) have been added to the USAddress class to return state name, state code, ZIP Code, and city name respectively. This enriches the functionality offered by the USAddress class for address handling.

Upgrade version to 4.7.4 and refactor string utility method
The application version has been upgraded to 4.7.4. Additionally, the string utility method to concatenate two strings has been refactored to now concatenate two string arrays, enhancing the method functionality.

Upgrade version to 4.7.4 and refactor string utility method
The application version has been upgraded to 4.7.4. Additionally, the string utility method to concatenate two strings has been refactored to now concatenate two string arrays, enhancing the method functionality.

Add configurable timeouts to HTTP and SOAP classes
Timeout settings for HTTP and SOAP connections are now configurable. Two new methods have been added to each class to set the read and connection timeouts, while previously hard-coded values have been replaced. Project version has also been bumped to 4.7.5.

Update version to 4.7.6 and refactor SOAP class
The application version in pom.xml has been upgraded to 4.7.6. The SOAPAction assignment has been relocated to the constructor in the SOAP class, which improves the clarity and readability of the code.

Update version and refactor HTTP and SOAP methods
Upgraded the project version to 4.7.7 in pom.xml. Refactored the HTTP's connection cleanup method and SOAP's request mechanism. The SOAPAction is now assigned during the request instead of during initialization, aiming for better code clarity.

Update project version and refactor SOAP.java
The project version in pom.xml has been updated from 4.7.7 to 4.7.8. In SOAP.java, a new method 'requesting' is introduced, which is invoked just prior to sending a request to the server, allowing for potential additional controls on the HTTP request.

Add comprehensive comments in XML.java and update project version
Added detailed Javadoc comments to almost all methods in XML.java to improve the code's readability and maintainability. Also, the project version was updated from 4.7.8 to 4.7.9 in the pom.xml file.

Add comprehensive comments in XML.java and update project version
Added detailed Javadoc comments to almost all methods in XML.java to improve the code's readability and maintainability. Also, the project version was updated from 4.7.8 to 4.7.9 in the pom.xml file.

Add comprehensive comments in XML.java and update project version
Added detailed Javadoc comments to almost all methods in XML.java to improve the code's readability and maintainability. Also, the project version was updated from 4.7.8 to 4.7.9 in the pom.xml file.

Update project version and enhance JavaDoc in StringList
The project version has been incremented in the pom.xml file, from 4.7.9 to 4.7.10. Moreover, new comprehensive JavaDoc comments were added and minor refactorings were made in StringList to improve code readability and maintainability.

Add new Fault codes and update version to 4.7.11
Introduced new Fault codes related to deposit account, GL account, and partial transaction commitment. Also, updated project version in pom.xml from 4.7.10 to 4.7.11. No key changes in workspace.xml.

Add new Fault codes and update version to 4.7.11
Introduced new Fault codes related to deposit account, GL account, and partial transaction commitment. Also, updated project version in pom.xml from 4.7.10 to 4.7.11. No key changes in workspace.xml.

Update version to 4.8.0 and refactor DateUtility methods
Updated project version in pom.xml to 4.8.0. Refactored InputOutputStream and added GMT conversion methods in DateUtility. Enhanced workspace.xml with detailed change tracking.

Update version to 4.8.0 and refactor DateUtility methods
Updated project version in pom.xml to 4.8.0. Refactored InputOutputStream and added GMT conversion methods in DateUtility. Enhanced workspace.xml with detailed change tracking.

Update version to 4.8.1 and refactor DateUtility methods
Updated project version in pom.xml to 4.8.1. Refactored InputOutputStream and made GMT conversion methods in DateUtility static. Enhanced workspace.xml with detailed change tracking.
4.8.2 Dependency update.
4.8.2 Dependency update.
4.8.3 Dependency update.

Update to version 4.8.4 and fix documentation
Updated project version in pom.xml to 4.8.4. Fixed multiple typos and improved documentation across various classes, including StringUtility, TriFunction, and CheckWithPrevious. Enhanced consistency in internal code comments and formatting.

Upgrade Java version and update to version 5.0.0
Updated project to use Java 21 (JDK and Maven configuration). Bumped version in pom.xml to 5.0.0. Replaced thread executor with virtual threads for improved performance. Note: Requires Java 21. If you want to use older versions of Java, please use 4.x versions.

Upgrade Java version and update to version 5.0.0
Updated project to use Java 21 (JDK and Maven configuration). Bumped version in pom.xml to 5.0.0. Replaced thread executor with virtual threads for improved performance. Note: Requires Java 21. If you want to use older versions of Java, please use 4.x versions.

Upgrade Java version and update to version 5.0.1
Updated project to use Java 21 (JDK and Maven configuration). Bumped version in pom.xml to 5.0.1. Replaced thread executor with virtual threads for improved performance. Note: Requires Java 21. If you want to use older versions of Java, please use 4.x versions.

Version 5.0.2 Note: Requires Java 21. If you want to use older versions of Java, please use 4.x versions.
Replace daemon threads with virtual threads for improved performance
Dropped the class DaemonThread. You can use virtual thread instead of such a class.
Replaced all custom daemon thread implementations with virtual threads to leverage modern concurrency features. The transition improves system resource management and aligns with Java 21's capabilities. Also included minor bug fixes and optimizations for thread-safe behaviors.

Replace daemon threads with virtual threads for improved performance
Dropped the class DaemonThread. You can use virtual thread instead of such a class.
Replaced all custom daemon thread implementations with virtual threads to leverage modern concurrency features. The transition improves system resource management and aligns with Java 21's capabilities. Also included minor bug fixes and optimizations for thread-safe behaviors.
